; Lucy Challenger, a blogger who claims to be a "British etiquette expert", posted a video on TikTok, Teach netizens how to eat rice with a knife and fork in formal occasions. She believes that in a Western environment, one should not eat rice with hands, spoons or chopsticks, but should push the rice to the top of the back of the fork with a table knife and then put it elegantly into the mouth, which can appear more educated and graceful. This "aristocratic" video triggered all kinds of ridicule and ridicule.

;

;Many Chinese people also like to emphasize the concept of nobility, such as nobility in houses, cars, and clothing brands... Even a few days ago, I even saw the "nobility" in latex paint in building materials stores.

;

;They say they are aristocrats, but in fact they are mostly consumption paranoia. The social group of aristocrats has died, or is close to death, in both Eastern and Western societies. It is also an interesting historical review journey to have a general understanding of the birth, development, decline, and demise of aristocrats in Eastern and Western societies.

;

;In ancient Eastern and Western societies, aristocrats were born almost at the same time in the early stages of civilization. The development can be roughly divided into three major historical stages: classical aristocracy, ancient aristocracy, and modern aristocracy.

;

;Classical aristocracy began in the Western Zhou Dynasty and Spring and Autumn Period in the East, and emerged in the Republic of Ancient Rome in the West. Because they arose in the early days of agricultural society, the classical nobility in the East and West all originated from large landowners. In the Spring and Autumn Period in the East, princes were nobles, and the feudal system was an ancient system of large land ownership. Dining with bells and dishes, wine pools and meat forests are the lifestyles of nobles that distinguish them from common people. The titles of duke, marquis, uncle, son, and male divided the nobility hierarchy, including the "scholar" class attached to the nobility, and constituted the ruling order of ancient oriental agricultural society.

;

;In the West, in ancient Greek society, which was slightly earlier than ancient Rome, the aristocracy was not very powerful. Due to the lack of large contiguous areas of land in the Balkans, ancient Greece developed an early democratic system that reflected the demands of the wealthy business class in the city-states for an equal distribution of power. Rome owned a large amount of land in its conquered areas, such as North Africa and Spain, so it produced a large number of landed aristocrats. They were a strong foundation supporting the Roman Empire and shared power in the Senate.

;

;In the era of classicism, the aristocrats of the East and West not only monopolized a large amount of land and wealth, but also monopolized culture, knowledge, and art, producing and consuming amazing cultural and artistic achievements of that era: Ancient Greece and Roman sculpture and architectural art, as well as the elegance and praise in the Eastern "Chu Ci" and "Poetry".

;

;The 4th and 5th centuries AD were a watershed era in the changes of human civilization: the classical civilizations in the East and West (Eastern Han Dynasty and Western Rome) were defeated by the northern barbarians, and human civilization entered a period of darkness that lasted for hundreds of years. Era (or "Middle Ages"). The classical nobility died out in this era, and instead, the second round of "ancient nobility" (medieval nobility) emerged in both the East and the West. Moreover, in this era, both the East and the West produced military lord aristocrats.

;

;In the West, after the Germanic tribes conquered the Western Roman Empire, they divided territories and enfeoffed feudal lords, resulting in a large number of barbarian military nobles. These medieval nobles were rough, unpretentious, and simple... almost all of them They are illiterate. They only emphasize the spirit of martial arts. They compete with each other on whose arms are thicker, stronger, and have longer swords. If nothing happens, they compete on horseback. European military aristocrats regarded reading and writing as shameful and unmanly. The writing needs at the administrative level were almost entirely borne by priests and attendants. As a result, Christianity monopolized the ideology, culture and art of medieval Europe.

;

;In the East at the same time, the gentry (similar to aristocrats) in the Southern and Northern Dynasties and the Sui and Tang Dynasties were divided: the southern gentry, because of their "dress and clothes", had higher cultural and artistic accomplishments, and were known as elegant and weak. The northern aristocracy has a considerable part of the Hu people's ancestry, and their cultural and artistic standards are low, but their military force value is high. This supported the "Guanlong military aristocracy" of the Sui and Tang dynasties. In the 6th and 7th centuries AD, the northern aristocratic army conquered the southern gentry, and China entered the second era of great unification.

;

;Unification promoted economic and social development, and culture and art also flourished. Although the cultural level of the northern aristocrats was low, they were still improving. Their huge wealth was enough to support and consume great masters such as Li Bai, Du Fu, Wu Daozi, Yan Liben, and Li Guinian. The prosperity of the Tang Dynasty created the peak era of national culture and art.

;

;The development of culture and art seems to inevitably lead to weak, hedonistic, decadent and even decadent lifestyles, both in the East and the West. In the East, the "Huang Chao Uprising" at the end of the Tang Dynasty completely ended the aristocratic era in China. To put it simply, all the nobles were killed, and "the bones of the public officials were trampled on in the streets." Since the Tang Dynasty, there have been no aristocrats in China. It has entered the era of common people and landlords. The emperor and his relatives are also representatives of the common people and landlords.

;

;France is similar. From after the "Hundred Years' War" to before the "Great Revolution", the French aristocrats were prosperous, extravagant and luxurious. They lived a paradise-like life on earth for hundreds of years and created astonishing world-class culture and art. At the same time, it burned up the national wealth and led to the social and economic collapse of France. In the end, the entire modern French aristocratic group was almost ended on the guillotine.

;

;Germany and England are the Anglo-Saxon branches of the Germanic ethnic group, and their medieval martial ethics lasted relatively long. The tradition of military aristocracy of these two ethnic groups even lasted until the middle of the 20th century. Until the two world wars, machine guns, cannons, tanks, bombers... ended a large number of British and German military aristocrats on the battlefield, and the modern aristocracy in Europe finally declined.

;

;The movie "Kingsman: The Secret Service" vividly tells this historical process: As a large number of military nobles died on the battlefield, the vast aristocratic wealth became ownerless property, CEOs (not Boss) promoted the modern transformation of European society.

;

;In modern society, the rise of the elite class is no longer the aristocracy.

;

;Nobility is identity politics and hereditary. The elite emphasizes non-identity politics, ability first, self-strength, and survival of the fittest. According to our ancient saying, "Excellence in learning leads to officialdom." However, it is not enough to study well. You must also be good at doing things, obey laws and regulations, and be socially responsible. The elites of modern society: Most of them come from the civilian class, such as Elon Musk. Before he became successful, he also paved the floor in his garage.

;

;Modern elite politics does not monopolize power like aristocratic politics, but breaks class solidification and opens up channels for individual advancement and dimensionality reduction, which is of great significance for preventing social rigidity and corruption.

;

;Even Musk, the world’s richest man with hundreds of billions of dollars, has some unscrupulous sons. If we cannot effectively inherit, pioneer, and enterprising, we will fall back into mediocrity and will not be able to enjoy the hereditary privileges of the nobility. This is the modern elite system.

;

;I hope that everyone can cheer up and make progress as much as possible, produce as many elites as possible to promote social progress, realize self-worth, and have fewer aristocratic dreams. That concept has been eliminated by history.

;

;;

;

;;(Southern People Weekly reporter Jiang Xiaoming /Picture);

;

;Kintaro Candy

;

;On October 30, 2023, the movie "The Thing My Dad Didn't Tell" held its premiere in Beijing. The film is directed by Japanese director Yojiro Takita and stars Zhang Guoli and Han Geng. This is the first time that Yojiro Takita has directed a Chinese-language film, adapted from Xin You's novel "Smell the Smoke". In the story, the Liu family has been making ice crystal cakes for generations, and it was passed down to the eighth generation Liu Jiansan. His father Liu Tingshen was still unwilling to reveal the secret recipe, and the two gradually became estranged. It wasn't until his father passed away that the secret recipe and the secrets accompanying it finally surfaced.

;

;The film was finalized as early as 2018. After several twists and turns, the finalized poster was finally released recently, and it was officially announced that it will be released nationwide on November 3.

;

;This is not the first film by Yojiro Takita to encounter setbacks. The highlight of his career, "The Embalmer," was released after a year's delay after filming was completed. "The Embalmer" is adapted from "The Diary of a Coffin Bearer" written by Shinmon Aoki. The author compiled his many years of experience into a book. In the world narrated by the coffin bearer, the deceased and the undertaker completed the passing of human life from generation to generation at a certain moment during the funeral ceremony. The movie starts from this and unfolds a sad and melancholy story around the protagonist who performs rituals for the deceased's body. "The Embalmer" won the 2009 Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film and swept the Japan Film Academy Awards - a total of 13 nominations and 8 wins.

;

;Takita Yojiro recalled that the protagonist of the movie dealt with corpses every day, and the Japanese were not willing to accept it, let alone face death. The subject of the film thus became taboo. No company was willing to release it for fear of not selling well. In 2008, "The Embalmer" won awards at China's Golden Rooster and Hundred Flowers Film Festival and Canada's Montreal Film Festival. The news spread back to Japan, and the film was only released in theaters (;September 13, 2008;) became popular and topped the box office. During the Oscar awards season, although the box office had declined and dropped out of the rankings, it returned to the top of the box office once the news of the award was announced.

;

;Previously, Takita Yojiro's most famous work was "Onmyoji" directed in 2001, starring Nomura Mansai and Hideaki Ito; and "Onmyoji" directed in 1986, starring Yuya Uchida, Yumi Aso, and Takeshi Kitano. No Funny Magazine. The former is adapted from the "Onmyoji" series of novels by Dream Pillow Tapir, which tells the story of Abe Seimei, an onmyoji with superb magic skills in Japan's Heian period, who used his wisdom to exorcise ghosts and gods and solve difficult problems. The latter vividly reproduced many real events that occurred in Japan in 1985, revealing the dark side of society and condemning the media for its failure.

;

;Before the publication of the transformational work "Don't Funny Magazine", Takita Yojiro was once known as a "pink movie" (; refers to a large number of Famous for movies that feature nudity;). On December 4, 1955, Yojiro Takita was born in Takaoka City, Toyama Prefecture, Japan. In 1973, after graduating from Takaoka Commercial High School, he went to Tokyo to pursue his dream. At the age of 20, he joined Lion Film Production Company as an assistant director. In 1981, he directed his debut film "Crazy Female Teacher". In the next five years, he filmed 21 pink movies mainly in the "Crazy Train" series. Although this type of film uses female nudity and male-female sex as gimmicks, its themes are diverse, including serious dramas, light comedies, and even suspense dramas. The whimsy and fun of Takita's works earned him the nickname "Pink Movie Genius" .

;

;“At that time, the sun was setting in the Japanese film industry, and audiences rarely went to the movies. Some people watched pink movies, but the market demanded that filming be completed quickly at a very low cost. Many people wanted to make movies but had nowhere to go. Those who could go joined the ranks. There are too many people in the world who are determined to make movies, and I am one of them." Takita Yojiro recalled.

;

;At that time, he worked 15 hours a day and was bored with 35mm film all day long. When he was young, Takita Yojiro often went to the cinema with his family, and movies would be shown in the school gymnasium. He would often watch and think, "Isn't this movie about me?" But he didn't know what it would be like to actually make a movie.

;

;;

;

;"The Embalmer" ;;

;

;"Even such a person who is full of anxiety and uncertain future I am willing to invest alone in the world. I believe that only those who are exposed to this world and discover something about themselves after going through hardships can survive." Yojiro Takita said, "There are no rules to follow in anything. At that time, living in this world , can’t see dreams, and feels that having dreams is a luxury. All he can do is work hard to complete the things in front of him." He remembered the words of a senior director he knew well - he hoped that he would be entangled in film and die.

;

;"Being surrounded by film, I deeply understand the meaning of film and movies. As well as editing, I understand the importance of frame by frame. In these senses, the era of pink movies is My origin. Although it was very painful at the time, there were many happy partners. We cried together, laughed together, and drank together."

;

;Takita Yojiro once described his works as "Kintaro candy". Kintaro candy is a candy that Japanese children use on the Seven-Five-Three Festival (;Similar to Children's Day, celebrating the growth of children aged 3, 5, and 7 years old;) The edible candies come in a variety of patterns, and are "long, sweet candies" that need to be cut off bit by bit to eat. No matter where this candy is cut, the cross-section pattern is the same, only the outermost layer is different in color. He believes that although his works have various themes, when you really cut them apart, they are all the same movies. In his conversation with Takita Yojiro, the writer Zhian summarized this similar core as: about how ordinary people can prove themselves and realize their own value through an action.

;

;It was also during that conversation that Yojiro Takita looked back on his career and lamented that he had always carefully selected job offers and rejected many works. Now he is more concerned about "Why are you looking for me? What is the reason for choosing me to be the director?" If there are consistent answers to the two questions, he will happily accept it. The next piece "Smell the Smoke" is the result of this thinking. This is a Chinese movie, with all Chinese actors, and he wanted to do something fun.

;

;"As a director, I need to run around and be busy, but at the same time, I am also observing myself objectively. For example, sitting here for an interview, there is actually someone I am standing on high, looking down at. I am thinking about myself. In my head, on the one hand, there is this objective consciousness of always reflecting on myself, and on the other hand, I am rushing forward like a wild boar, running straight towards the goal." said Yojiro Takita.

;

;Before leaving for filming, his wife did not say to him, "Come back after making a good movie." Instead, she told him: "Don't get angry in front of everyone."

;

;"Movie Good or bad, people don't care." Takita Yojiro said with a smile.

;

;In July 2019, we had the opportunity to watch an early version of the movie "The Thing My Dad Didn't Tell" and interviewed Yojiro Takita. In the interview, he talked about his motivation for making Chinese movies and his understanding of the film. Views on traditional disorder, the film’s response to changes in the times and people’s hearts, etc.

;

;;

;

;"Onmyoji" ;;

;

;The following is a dialogue with Yojiro Takita:

;

;A story about reconciliation and rebirth

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;Just listened to the staff After reading the novel "Smell the Smoke", you felt that the story was actually a bit Japanese. What parts of it touched you and made you decide to film it? ;

;

;;Takita Yojiro:;;The family structure of China and Japan is very similar. The father is the backbone of the entire family, so daily life, father-son relationship, Cultural inheritance will also have many similarities. The original setting is a story that happened in a small town in China. This story can be copied to the Japanese countryside. This made me feel very familiar, and it was one of the motivations for me to try to make this film. ;

;

;My personal favorite is that the father has been keeping secrets and sticking to himself, and his intentions were only felt by his son after he passed away. This misunderstanding, sadness, and ultimate mutual recognition is what captures my heart the most. In other words, this is a story about reconciliation and rebirth.

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;Like the novel, you still use the son's perspective to construct the story Why did you choose this perspective on the relationship between father and son? And why make such a movie in modern times? ;

;

;;Takita Yojiro:;;I was still thinking about this issue until yesterday. In fact, as we grow older, people’s way of thinking will become more and more fixed. and limitations, the scope of action may become narrower and narrower. The world of young people is more interesting, they have many expectations for life, there are incompleteness and immaturity, and the collision of various elements will lead to the development of the story. ;

;

;Of course, this also depends on the background of the times and career settings. Japan has many old shops that have been inherited from generation to generation, and there are also many stories about craftsmen. The world of traditional crafts is a world where seniors and juniors fight, because values ​​​​are different from the times, and it is inevitable for juniors to want to surpass their seniors.

;

;I wonder if it is the same in China. Therefore, this story is set before the 2008 Beijing Olympics. The economy is growing rapidly, people's economic activities are becoming more and more important to the world, and in order to successfully integrate into the modern world, the traditional world is gradually losing order.

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;What do you think of these? ;

;

;;Takita Yojiro:;;I think this is not a good thing from the perspective of changes in values ​​and the changes that follow. Everything is digital now and you want fast results. People always think that when they do something, the result is there and they can get there quickly. But traditional craftsman-style things are just the opposite. Through accumulation, various techniques are passed on, and ways of thinking and feelings are refined. ;

;

;For example, this 6cm×6cm camera (;points at the photojournalist’s medium format film camera;), it has existed a long time ago, 40 years ago, it is very rare, and it is still in use. There must be something in it that you want to stick to.

;

;Japan held the Olympic Games in 1964, which was very similar to China. It developed rapidly after that. It’s just that the speed of development was “additive” at that time, but now it feels like “multiplicative”.

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;You graduated from high school a few years after the Japan Olympics. There are reports that you were faced with two directions at that time, whether to find a job directly or continue studying. So did you feel confused in the accelerating social environment? What was your state at that time, and why did you go to Tokyo? ;

;

;;Takita Yojiro: ;;Because I didn’t pass the college entrance examination, it doesn’t matter if I tell you. (;laugh;) I was very confused, and for the first time I realized, what have I been doing for so many years? I'm very lonely. Like Jian San (;Yu Jian San, the male protagonist of "Smell the Smoke";), I also grew up in a small place, so I just wanted to stop staying there and go to Tokyo. I thought I would find something in the city. ;

;

;After I went there, the level of prosperity and the number of people were completely different, and there were no parents nagging you behind your back. It felt like heaven. So when I first started working as a director, I shot all the cities.

;

;But as I got married and had children, the entire film industry environment changed, and the depth and breadth of my interactions changed, I began to realize that my hometown before I was 18 years old was something I couldn’t forget, including "The Embalmer" also has the feeling of returning to a small town.

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;What are those unforgettable things? ;

;

;;Takita Yojiro: ;;The terraced fields, the smell of the river, the light miso soup, udon noodles, the smell of my parents’ house, my mother’s smell. As humans, we never forget where we were born. ;

;

;;

;

;"Northern Sakura Mamoru" ;;

;

;Being full of something Enthusiastic people

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;How did you enter the film industry after arriving in Tokyo? Are you sure you want to make movies in the future? ;

;

;;Takita Yojiro: ;;It was completely a coincidence. It was only after I entered this industry that I found it interesting. Everyone has always believed that the world of entertainment and movies, including singing, is the domain of a few or special people. About half a year to a year later, I discovered that this was not the case. Whether it was lighting or photography, they were actually just people who were passionate about something. ;

;

;In this case, can I also make this thing? I worked very hard and studied a lot about movies.

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;Do you still remember what happened on the first day you entered the set? ? ;

;

;;Takita Yojiro: ;;I just looked at it blankly, didn’t understand anything, and kept getting scolded. (;Laugh;);

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;I heard that the pay for being an assistant director at that time was very bad, and many young people left. ;

;

;;Takita Yojiro: ;;The reality is that everyone around you will give up. Many people enter the film industry with aspirations, but once they arrive on set, they feel a lot of physical and interpersonal fatigue. ;

;

;The film industry has been in recession for a long time, with little funding, low income, no future, and hard work. But there are many things that even quitting can't do anything about. What can I do if I don't do this? I feel like quitting is just an escape.

;

;To use a Japanese proverb, this industry is like water, and I happen to be a fish. I am in it like a fish in water, which is very interesting. I never thought of quitting.

;

;;

;

;"The Thing My Dad Didn't Say" ;;

;

;;Southern People Weekly: ;;How much did it cost to make a movie at that time? ;

;

;;Takita Yojiro:;;3 million yen (;Editor Note: It was during Japan’s bubble economy period and the inflation rate was rising;), and the shoot was completed in four to five days. Why did I then want to make films in various genres? I wanted to be challenged more than just being in a world with a small budget. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;Your first transformation should be in the 1990s A series of comedy films were produced during that period when Japan’s bubble economy burst. What impact did the external environment have on your creation? How did you understand comedy at that time? ;

;

;;Takita Yojiro: ;;Japan in the 1990s, as you said, has undergone many changes. After the bubble economy burst, many major events occurred in Japan, such as the Great Hanshin Earthquake. So, for a while, people who were very driven became insubstantial. Nothingness, nothingness, in short, the belief that life and the world are nothingness. I will think about what we live for? The works from that time also wanted to ask what the meaning of survival is. ;

;

;Life can sometimes be a comedy. A person has many sides, depending on the perspective from which he is viewed. Sometimes the person is serious, like a school teacher, sometimes not. People in life always have both sides. I actually think everything can be a comedy depending on the content of the movie and the angle of editing.

;

;Also, I really like comedy. It makes me feel warm to see people laughing or feeling relaxed because of this stuff. After all, life is often difficult, isn't it?

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;What about historical dramas? ;

;

;;Takita Yojiro: ;;Costume dramas are free in a sense, and you can do whatever you want. This is not an escape, but another form of realization of the ideal. ;

;

;In reality, when traditions are disappearing and have disappeared, historical dramas often focus on the beauty, tradition and etiquette of people. This kind of thing is clearly filmed, allowing people to see the beauty of culture. , making them feel like “this is who we are” or that’s who they want to be.

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;During the process of filming and re-watching, did you also Will you be impressed by what's in it? ;

;

;;Takita Yojiro: ;;It’s another thing for me. I’m always afraid of not being good enough when watching my own movies. Yesterday I was in the movie Another 6 minutes were cut off for the same reason. Is it better this way? Is it better that way? There is such a sense of fear. Let’s leave this to the audience. (;Laugh;);

;

Yang Ping asked again: "Are there any paintings on the walls in the temple?" Yang Ping's Shanxi dialect is a bit different from that of his fellow villagers, but it does not hinder their communication.要跑遍山西的角角落落，没有这样的语言优势，杨平还真拍不到那些庙里的“画画”。

;

;提起山西壁画，人们总会想起岩山寺、永乐宫这样精美的宋元壁画，但很多人不知道，隐藏在山水之间的山西村落，保存着大量的村庙壁画。比起宋元壁画“享受”到的保护、研究和世人的赞叹，村庙里的壁画显得有些落寞。它们一般都是清代的遗存，“这些清代壁画，不用说'国保'了，连'村保'都不是。”杨平说。它们安静地扮演着村庄神祇塑像的背景，也是村民们生活里的一抹情趣。

;

;;

;

;山西省朔州市朔城区南曹村某村庙东壁壁画局部。 ;（受访者供图/图）;

;

;杨平已经拍了十多年山西壁画了。和很多爱好者入门拍壁画一样，杨平一开始也拍宋元壁画，拍得多了，她发现山西还有更多的壁画隐藏在人迹罕至的山野小庙里，“很多人拍到'省保'就为止了，但我不一样，我要到村里去转。”她说。

;

;杨平早年是旅行杂志的主编，杂志停刊后，她把精力完全放在山西的壁画和彩塑上。这些年来，她拍了山西四百多处壁画，其中明清的占了三百多处，“我知道但还没有拍的大约还有二三十处”。 《高堂粉墙烛下见——中国山西乡村古壁画探幽》是她2023年出版的新书，里面收录的21处精美的村庙壁画，大多是清代晚期的，其中很多都是她首次发现的。

;

;打开这本小书，一种与宋元壁画的高古、宏大完全不同的艺术气质扑面而来，秾丽的色彩、富有生活气息的神祇形象、小巧紧凑的构图，无不昭示着这是来自民间草根的审美情趣。杨平给这21处壁画写了21个小故事，大多是她与村民的聊天，家长里短，乡野旧闻，写来轻松有趣，但是在采访中，杨平说得更多的却是拍摄背后的甘苦，以及她对乡村壁画的种种忧思。

;

;“每个时代遗留下来的文化，都反映了那个时代。乡村壁画不仅仅是艺术的呈现，里面还有很多历史信息。这本书的言外之意，其实在壁画之外。”杨平说。

;

;“带回来的片子，几乎全部作废”

;

;杨平的老家是山西晋城，晋城以古建筑闻名。 2003年，杨平自己掏出36万元，开始拍摄晋城的古建筑。建筑拍得多了，她渐渐地对建筑内部的壁画产生了兴趣。别看她现在成天往村子里跑，瞧着灰头土脸，但她说其实自己最爱打扮，以前做时尚旅行杂志，喜欢漂亮衣服，最初爱上壁画，也是因为壁画的美。

;

;2012年，杨平得到了一个机会，可以拍摄山西各地的壁画和彩塑。当时她只知道那些在文物名录上的壁画，至于山西到底有多少壁画，她并不清楚。

;

;一开始没有拍壁画的经验，杨平向山西撒了一张大网：山西十一个地级行政区，每个行政区派一支摄影队，每队至少三人，由一位知名摄影家领衔，加一个灯光、一个司机，打算对全山西的壁画、彩塑进行地毯式拍摄。这是一项庞大的工程，花费不菲，但效果却令人大失所望。

;

;“带回来的片子，几乎全部作废。”杨平想起当时自己的“莽撞”，不自觉露出苦笑。当年杨平请来的摄影师都是行业里的“大腕”，“他们对怎样拍得好看有自己的认知。你说拍成这样，他认为那样的才好看。而且很多他们觉得不好看的就不拍。”

;

;但是忠实地记录与“拍得好看”是两回事。要忠实地记录一铺壁画的全貌和其中的每个细节，每张照片的像素就要足够大，这就需要对一铺壁画进行分区拍摄。然而印制到书本上的壁画至少需要有一幅是完整的，这就又要保证每部分拍回来的照片都是可拼合的，也就意味着拍摄同一铺壁画的不同部分，其拍摄角度、像素、光线、曝光度，都要做到尽量一致。

;

;;

;

;诸龙寺大殿东壁壁画全图。 ;（受访者供图/图）;

;

;拍下的局部图如果要合成一张整图，上百张照片拼合，合成的时间就要半个月，整幅图的大小动辄几十个G。 “他们从来没有这么拍过。”杨平说。摄影师们各自为政，拍回来的照片风格各异，美则美矣，就是“合不了”。

;

;还有些三四米高的壁画，如果梯子不够高，摄影角度的变化就会造成画面的畸变，也是“合不了”。 “一看这个图片不行，回来培训，又去拍，还不行，就买很多书给大家看……”

;

;这次不成功的地毯式拍摄让杨平赔了很多钱，十一支摄影队的仪器、差旅、人工，全打了水漂。到后来，她意识到，不是摄影队越多就效率越高，掌握拍摄的准则才是最关键的。她把摄影队缩小到了两支，其中一支就由她自己来拍。面对一铺壁画，要形成比较标准的拍摄流程：大小的梯子必须要有，对墙壁进行分区的红外线仪也要有，镜头是标准的蔡司50，还要有一个手持的小相机，“很多塑像离壁画很近，手要伸进去拍”。

;

;拍村里的壁画，除了这些一般的设备之外，铁锹和鸡毛掸子也是必备的，后者用来拂去壁画上的灰尘，前者则是修路的工具，“通往村里的是土路，用得上”。有一次到吕梁的一个村子，路况糟糕，摄影师用铁锹铲了一个多小时，才铲出一条“路”来。最后三百米，实在是没办法，只能大小器材都扛着走进村。

;

;“三十年前题记还在”

;

;走进杨平的工作室，首先看见的就是一整排山西寺观壁画的图册。 《岩山寺》《开化寺》《公主寺》……这些在壁画史上赫赫有名的寺观，杨平都相应做了极为精细的图册。这些图册是她十几年来拍摄壁画的成果之一。在她之前，当然也有人拍过它们，也出过很多图册，但她想要做的是把每个细节都拍清楚。

;

;“像这本《岩山寺》就拍了三年，2013、2014、2015年，陆陆续续拍，每次都要补拍，出版的时候发现某块不够清晰，就重新拍。”杨平说。岩山寺的金代壁画被誉为壁上的《清明上河图》，人物繁多，细节丰富，浓郁的生活气息就隐藏在画面细节之中。杨平的要求是画面上每个人物的身份、每个佛道故事的典故，乃至对首饰名物的辨认，不仅要有清晰的图像，还要附有学术文字的解释。所以她做的图册比前人要厚很多，八开本的一大本《岩山寺》厚达三百多页。

;

;到2013年冬天，像岩山寺、开化寺这样的“国保”“省保”，差不多都被她拍完了，杨平开始系统地拍摄村庙里的壁画。

;

;一开始，对于村庙壁画，杨平只是路过的时候顺手拍，但拍得多了，她慢慢意识到，村里的明清壁画，比起宋元壁画，自有它的价值，完全值得再去搜罗一遍。

;

;山西古村落里，民间信仰的庙宇有着很多常见的神祇，关帝庙、娘娘庙（三霄娘娘）、龙王庙、马王庙、东岳庙，它们可能会单独出现，也可能会“组团”出现——即在一个庙中分布于不同的配殿里。龙王保佑风调雨顺、娘娘保佑生育平安、关帝则保佑教育子女忠孝节义。 “生娃、教育、农业，都是老百姓的真实需求。”杨平说。

;

;;

;

;山西某村庙北壁龙王母右侧的女官、两位四值使者和风婆（从右至左）。 ;（受访者供图/图）;

;

;有一次，一尊庙里的东岳神挡住了去路。那个庙的主殿两壁都是精美的彩塑，殿中央却立着一尊不知道年代的彩塑，藏身在一个小小的木阁里，据说是后世的村民们给加上去的。杨平要拍两旁的彩塑，镜头却总是被这尊东岳神彩塑给遮挡，摄影师们去拍了五次，拍回来总是不好看。无奈之下，第六次拍摄时她和村里人商量：“能不能先把这尊神请到殿外？”

;

;旧时，这尊东岳神每年都要抬出来游街，近些年，这个仪式已经渐渐消逝，但村里老人还是担心，像这样不合常规地抬出来，会造成不祥。 “他们担心会引起暴雨。”杨平说。几十年没动过的木胎泥塑，移动稍有不慎，表面很可能就会碎裂。

;

;好不容易说服了村民，具体要怎么搬，杨平自己心里也没有底。几个人正围着神像急得团团转的时候，村里的一位老人站了出来，只见他拿着一根粗麻绳，用一种从来没见过的打结方式，快速将神像捆得四平八稳，四个人一抬，上下不会倾斜，左右也不会侧翻。 “要是没有这位老人的帮忙，我们真拍不到这样好看的照片。”杨平指着图册上的这页彩塑说。拍完后，东岳神被重新安放了回去，当然，村里也没有下起暴雨。

;

;时间在流逝，壁画和彩塑也随着时间在改变。很多壁画和杨平最初看到它们的时候已经完全不一样了。 “我知道的一堂宋代壁画，三十年前题记还在，现在某些题记已经模糊了。”而一些无人关注的清代壁画，已经再也看不到了。

;

;《高堂粉墙烛下见》里提到的罗圈堡村是其中幸运的一个。当时，当地文物局听从了杨平的建议，把村庙修缮一新，壁画也重新做了拼合。 2021年杨平回访的时候，罗圈堡的壁画都还完好。但是像罗圈堡这样的例子实在太少了。作为文物大省，山西要用到钱的文物非常多，村庙里的壁画，似乎还排不上号。 “山西文物部门经常开玩笑说，让他们开两家银行，可能也不够。”杨平说。

;

;;

;

;罗圈堡村龙王庙壁画局部。 ;（受访者供图/图）;

;

;“文化是要滋养人的”

;

;到底要不要将村庙壁画出版，公之于众，杨平曾经犹豫过很久。 2016年，他们在太原附近的一个村子拍摄，摄影师被当地村民给撵走了。杨平非常理解老百姓的“警惕”：“文物贩子实在是太多了。”村庙里的壁画，一般连文保点都不是，官方的保护体系鞭长莫及，它们虽躲在深山，却躲不过文物贩子的“勤奋”。

;

;某种意义上来说，杨平就是在和文物贩子赛跑，“你完全想象不到他们有多'勤奋'，十年前我去的山沟里，文物贩子都走过。”杨平的朋友圈本来是完全开放的，自己看到了什么、拍到了什么，都会发在朋友圈，但不会发具体地址。有一次，一位朋友从外省追了过来，和她打听，“杨老师，你朋友圈里的东西，能不能给我一个地址？”杨平随即警惕了起来，对那位朋友说：“我手里的东西，你一个石头也不能拿走。”

;

;但是在这本《高堂粉墙烛下见》里，很多村庙却写了详细的地址。杨平说，这也是她思考了很久之后的无奈之举。一方面，把它们隐藏得再好，可能也逃不过文物贩子的搜索，而且就算文物贩子没有找到，书中多数村庙都已经半坍塌了，这样隐藏下去，等待它们的命运也是逐渐湮灭。 “不如公开它们的状况，引起全社会的重视，唤起村民的保护意识。”杨平明确知道一个英国的银行家家里，收藏有一铺清代的壁画，“我们的研究者目前也大多关心更高古的宋元壁画，清代壁画无人关心”。

;

;宋晓丽是杨平这本书的读者，2023年9月，她沿着书中的路线，走访了书中的几个村庄。她发现，很多村民的保护意识，确实比杨平拍摄时提高了不少。比如在瓦窑头村的龙王庙，“村民们有了保护意识，他们用厚厚的塑料布遮挡着壁画，我们拍摄完毕后又原样子给挡上，这是令人欣慰的发现。”宋晓丽告诉南方周末记者。

;

;然而，也有不幸的例子。书中提到的北曹村壁画，有非常生动的“龙王行雨图”。 “北曹村的龙王庙修缮一新，庙前立了文保碑，但是龙王殿里东西壁的龙王行雨图丢失了，文保部门将两幅喷绘的展示图分别悬挂于东西两壁。”宋晓丽说。

;

;;

;

;北曹村兴龙寺壁画局部。 ;（受访者供图/图）;

;

;徐村的三圣庙也难逃湮灭的命运。这是个明清时期集佛教与民间信仰为一体的庙宇，神殿三开间，供着不同的神祇。宋晓丽看到的景象和杨平书中的描写已经很不一样了，“整个北壁的壁画在雨水的侵蚀下漫漶脱落，露出地杖下一块块泥胚墙。西次间的墙壁上半部分已经坍塌，壁画无存。仅存的西壁壁画还算完整，然而西壁东北角却塌了好大的一个窟窿。”

;

;;

;

;三圣正殿西次间——龙王殿北壁的龙王母、五龙王、雨师等神像全图。该壁画已明显受损。 ;（受访者供图/图）;

;

;《高堂粉墙烛下见》卖得很好，有一点出乎杨平的意料。相对于她的整个出版计划来说，这本小书只展现了她工作的小小侧面。 “你做了这么多事情，没有人知道你在干什么，它老不冒火花，不冒泡。突然在这本书上红了。”书里的彩图，对于那些已经湮灭的壁画来说，是珍贵的记录。

;

;杨平最花心力的一套大书，是即将出版的《山西寺观艺术全集》，“全集”包括《山西寺观彩塑全集》（十卷）和《山西寺观壁画全集》（二十卷），共三十卷。她多年来拍摄的所有彩塑和壁画，都会收录进去，这是真正第一种尽可能完整地收录山西壁画彩塑艺术的出版物。

;

;《全集》的受众是专业的研究者，《高堂粉墙烛下见》的受众则是普通读者，杨平希望这本小书可以成为一个支点，撬动一点公众的认知。 “其实我有一个发心，文化不仅要吸引文化人，还要吸引更多的普通人，文化应该要滋养人的。我们现在的文化只滋养了一小批人，这是不够的。”杨平说。

;

;;17 parcels of land purchased 7 years ago at a cost of 8.525 billion yuan, after 6 years of development It was discovered that 14 pieces of land were seriously polluted. A lawsuit announcement by Shanghai Lujiazui Financial and Trade Zone Development Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as "Lujiazui") on November 4 aroused heated discussions among netizens. ;;;

;

;;This incident is not a simple dispute between companies. As more details were revealed, the case quickly became a hot topic on November 8. ;

;

;;

;

;;There are three main points that make the majority of netizens "eat melons":;

;

;;First, Lujiazui sued five units, among which the most Involving Jiangsu government departments. Lujiazui disclosed in the announcement that due to soil pollution problems, its subsidiaries have transferred Jiangsu Suzhou Iron and Steel Group Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as "Suzhou Iron and Steel Group"), Suzhou Environmental Science Institute, Suzhou Suzhou Environmental Technology Co., Ltd., Suzhou National The High-tech Industrial Development Zone Management Committee and the Suzhou Municipal Natural Resources and Planning Bureau went to court and recently received a written case acceptance notice from the Jiangsu Provincial Higher People's Court;;

;

;;The second is Lujiazui’s claim amount is as high as 10 billion yuan. According to industry estimates, the litigation costs of this lawsuit may be as high as 50 million yuan;;

;

;;Third, 14 cases of seriously contaminated land have attracted market attention . The land purchased in Lujiazui was purchased in 2016, but the contaminated land was not discovered until 2022. By this time, a large number of businesses had been built. Did the pollutants affect the construction workers? Why has no problem of excessive pollution been found during construction site operations for 6 years? Have you tried other options before filing a lawsuit? Wait for questions to follow;;. ;

;

;

Nanduwan Financial Society also called the above five defendants, but As of press time, the call had not been connected. ;

;

;;Many industry insiders told reporters from Wancaishe that complex interests are involved behind the "poisonous land", and the relevant departments of the Shanghai and Jiangsu governments should handle related issues rationally and prevent produce sequelae. ;

;

;;;After spending 8.5 billion in 222 rounds of bidding, ;;;;Lujiazui bought 14 “poisonous sites”? ;;

;

;;The incident originated from Lujiazui’s strategic decision to “go global” 7 years ago. ;

;

;;In 2016, Lujiazui’s designated holding subsidiaries Jiawan Company and Jiaer Company (through a trust plan) formed a consortium and jointly bid for the listing of Suzhou Iron and Steel Group Co., Ltd. on the Shanghai United Equity Exchange. 95% of the equity of Green'an Company was transferred. ;

;;

;

;;The development history of Suzhou Iron and Steel Group. Source: Suzhou Iron and Steel Group official website. ;

;

;;According to public reports at the time, this equity auction attracted more than 30 interested investors, with a total of 19 companies participating. ;

;;Lujiazui finally won 95% of the equity of Suzhou Green Bank Real Estate Development Co., Ltd. for a total price of 8.525 billion yuan (transaction price of 6.84 billion yuan, debt of 1.685 billion yuan). ;

;

;

;;However, Lujiazui's bold "going out" investment decision was not so smooth sailing. ;

;;

;

;;The announcement pointed out that the company organized a special force to verify and found that during the regulation adjustment and transfer process of Su Di No. 2008-G-6 plot, Suzhou Iron and Steel Group, the environment The testing agency and others are suspected of a series of violations, fraud, etc., which may have caused severely polluted land to enter the public trading market, and they concealed relevant information when listing and transferring 95% of Suzhou Green Bank's shares. ;

;

;;;If the land pollution identification is falsified, may the defendant face triple risks?;; ;;;;

;

;;In 2023, Lujiazui took the relevant parties to court. On November 4, it announced in an announcement that the court had filed the case. Accept relevant cases. ;

;

;;

;

;;Picture from Lujiazui official website;

;

;;In the context of relevant cases , Lujiazui said that since 2022, environmental investigations by the company and all parties have determined that 14 pieces of land under the name of Green Bank Company are polluted, and the polluted area and degree of pollution far exceed the pollution conditions disclosed by Suzhou Iron and Steel Group when it was listed for sale. ;

;

;;

;

;

;

;;It further stated that as far as Lujiazui Group is concerned, according to the current information, it has a large scale of construction, many types of projects, and a huge amount of capital investment in the land involved in the case. , and related projects were found to have serious pollution in the land during construction, completion, sales and other aspects. ;

;;;A claim of 10 billion yuan, what is the probability of winning? ;;

;;Wang Yuchen told reporters that if Suzhou Iron and Steel Group knew about the land contamination of the relevant land parcels at the time of the transfer and had the obligation to know but failed to perform it, it would Intentional concealment, etc. may not only affect the validity of the previous contract, but also face corresponding liability for breach of contract. ;

;Mother's magic shoes. ;(Visual China/Picture);

;

;Earlier, I was talking about that before she got sick, she wore the Leviathan sold by Azhen Pei magic shoes. In fact, she was already feeling uncomfortable at that time. She was lethargic, had diarrhea and had a fever. Maybe cancer cells were growing wildly in her body, but no one knew it.

;

;She said they were a pair of magical shoes. A pair sells for MYR 2,200. Azhen allowed her to take the shoes home first and try them on for a while before paying. She was satisfied, and perhaps felt she had taken advantage.

;

;So she wore them out, to breakfast in town, to the store, and to her son's wedding in Taiwan.

;

;"I almost fell!" she once said to me. I don’t know whether it was because she was too weak at the time, or whether the shoes made her feet uncomfortable.

;

;I never cared about those shoes. It was a place where people would believe in porcupine dates, talisman water and head-dropping magic. A pair of shoes is no big deal.

;

;But those are no ordinary shoes. Azhen said that they were energy health shoes with super magnets. The soles of the shoes contained carefully blended Chinese medicine, which could open the second heart of the human body and stimulate the body's self-healing energy ring.

;

;"Health comes from wearing it", it says on the paper bag of the shoes.

;

;By the time I saw those shoes, she was already a skinny, spiteful patient. She began to resent the shoes.

;

;Paradoxically, her friend Xiuli also suffers from cancer. But Xiuli didn't wear magic shoes. She ate the collagen powder sold by Azhen. They both eat it every day. That thing is quite troublesome, you have to eat it as soon as you get up, and the sooner you eat it, the better. Once, when we were traveling to Xi'an, she got up before dawn to boil water and make collagen powder. After drinking it, she went back to bed to sleep. The buzzing sound from the hotel kettle made my second sister and I upset.

;

;She didn’t want to see the pair of shoes, so she asked my sister and I to go to Azhen’s barber shop to return the shoes. She went to get a haircut that day, but she didn't go to Azhen's barber shop, nor to Alian's barber shop downstairs. She held an umbrella alone and walked to the barber shop upstairs in the back shop.

;

;My sister and I bravely walked into Azhen’s barber shop. Azhen was perming a woman's hair while talking to us. She showed us her and her daughter's shoes. They all wore black leather shoes that were exactly the same as their mother’s pair of Allipex magic shoes.

;

;"Look, my daughter and I wear them. I stand and work all day long, and my feet are not sore at all!" Azhen said.

;

;Of course the shoes cannot be returned. "Who would buy it after they've already been worn?" Azhen rejected us.

;

;A few days later, Xia Mu came to Ula Port, and his mother showed him the shoes.

;

;"I tell you how these shoes are deceiving, you write it down and publish it in your newspaper." She said to Xia Mu.

;

;Natsuki and I looked at each other, then took a look at the dull, ugly shoes.

;

;This is what she thinks writers and journalists should do. She can’t seem to tell the difference between a reporter and a writer. In her opinion, they are all scholars and writers, and they should use their pens to speak out for others and plead for the people.

;

;"I tell you, you write it down." That's what she said when she told me about her experience of nearly losing her life giving birth to her son.

;

;She herself is such a person, keen on upholding justice and speaking for others, which is completely opposite to her husband.

;

;For a period of time, in addition to working in the tailor shop, she was also busy applying for relief funds for the poor people passing through Hong Kong. She took a stack of application forms from the city council and distributed them to those who were struggling. When she met people who didn't know Malay, she asked her Malay friends to help fill out the forms because she didn't know much Malay herself.

;

;She also called the newspaper office and applied for the newspaper office’s relief fund for her friend.

;

;When she told me this, I was amazed at her ability and passion. I remembered something she said a long time ago. She said a fortune teller had predicted that if she continued to go to school, she would become a big shot like Li Jinshi. Li Jinshi was our former Minister of Health.

;

;She is very proud. She walked around Port Ula like a country squire, like a big shot.

;

;Soon her glory disappeared. She resented the magic shoes, resented her sister, and resented the person who deceived her.

;

;The night before the first chemotherapy session, in a hotel near the hospital, in the early hours of the morning, after vomiting out all her dinner, she told me a story about a woman. The woman received relief funds through her help, but she discovered that she was not poor. She and her husband ran a seafood business in a town not far from the port of Ula.

;

;"I still have their business cards." She said. She decided to call the newspaper to expose the woman.

;

;In less than a month, she herself became a person waiting for relief.

;

;My father said that she could apply for relief and that she should receive relief. So the city council came. The man was also my mother’s friend, and he had been handling the application forms submitted on my mother’s behalf.

;

;Azmin looked at his mother with deep understanding and compassion. He made an immediate decision and suggested that I take a photo of my mother. The mother had to lie in bed so that her illness could be fully revealed.

;

;I did not take pictures of my mother. Xia Mu also did not write a report for her to expose the scam.

;

;It was much later, five years after her death, that I thought I should search the Internet for introductions or news about magic shoes. I soon saw the report in Southern Metropolis Daily.

;

;That was a report in 2016. She wasn't sick yet. I was still teaching in school at that time. Two years later, I was no longer a teacher and she was a dying patient.

;

;When she showed us those shoes, why didn’t we think of searching online? Isn’t this the instinct and ability of us scholars?

;

;Maybe I don’t care how much she spent on a pair of shoes. Maybe I was already used to the fact that she was being fooled. It was a place where people believed in porcupine dates, talisman water and head-dropping magic.

;

;I respect other people’s beliefs and lives, I always say this.

;

;I have left Ula Port for a long time.

;

;"We don't need relief." We kids all thought so.

;

;I did not take pictures of my mother. Besides, my mother was unwilling to lie on the bed and let someone take a photo of her shame and despair.

;

;After her death, one Sunday afternoon, the second sister returned the pair of magic shoes to Azhen. She used the silk money she received from the funeral to pay Ah Zhen 2,200 ringgit.

;

;After she died, I found a newspaper clipping in her drawer. That was the news about the "Love in the World" child sponsorship program in Sin Chew Daily on November 29, 2014. There are portraits of five sixth-grade students on the newspaper clipping. The title of the report is "Repaying Sponsors with Good Results, Sin Chew Sponsored Students Achieve Excellent UPSR Results".

;

;I thought they were all children passing through Hong Kong, children she had helped. no.

;

;I know why she keeps that clipping. She loved stories like this, stories about struggle, hardship and reward, and gratitude. In the past, her children also received support from society with their excellent academic performance. She was proud of it, and she did not blush at all because of the deep aura of humility hidden in it.

;

;That pair of magic shoes may be on a woman's feet right now. We no longer talk about those past events. But I never forgot them.

;

;In the past, I didn’t do what a daughter could (should?) do, so now I do what a writer should do.

;

;If you want to ask what major disasters occurred in the era of Emperor Wu of the Han Dynasty, which reached the point of shaking the country's foundation, there is actually no dispute. The witchcraft disaster occurred in the second year of Zhenghe (91 BC). ——Witchcraft was a popular method at that time to use witchcraft to curse others. A common method was to pierce small wooden figures and bury them in the ground.

;

;Sima Qian stated that the time when this incident occurred was not within the coverage of "Historical Records". Even Ban Gu, who lived more than a hundred years later, probably because he was too sensitive, deliberately did not speak too clearly. In the biographies of the characters involved, the "Hanshu" talks so much that you can only read it after putting it together. Give a rough idea.

;

;There was a man named Jiang Chong who frantically framed the prince for using witchcraft to curse Emperor Wu of the Han Dynasty. The prince had no choice but to rebel. Emperor Wu of the Han Dynasty asked Prime Minister Liu Quyou to command the army and fight the prince in Chang'an City, and tens of thousands of people died. The prince was defeated and fled, eventually dying outside.

;

;Sima Qian had two good friends involved in this matter.

;

;One is Ren An, who was the "envoy of the Northern Army" at the time and controlled the largest army in Chang'an City. When the prince rebelled, he sent a military talisman in an attempt to transfer troops to Ren An, but Ren An stayed behind closed doors after receiving the military talisman. This matter was considered by Emperor Wu of the Han Dynasty to be "double-minded", so Ren An was beheaded by Emperor Wu of the Han Dynasty.

;

;One is Tian Ren, who is the Secretary of the Prime Minister's Office (an official under the Prime Minister's Office, responsible for supervising lawlessness, with a rank of two thousand stones, and is a senior official). At that time, he was assigned to guard the easternmost Fu'an in the south of Chang'an City. Door. The prince fled to this door, and he allowed the prince to escape. This crime is of course more serious and is also cut in half. Even the person who initially interceded for Tian Ren was so frightened that he committed suicide when Emperor Wu of the Han Dynasty scolded him.

;

;Sima Guang’s version: A traitor drives a wedge between father and son

;

;Sima Qian was working as a secretary to Emperor Wu of the Han Dynasty at that time, but he could only watch his friend being executed and did not dare to Say more words. In fact, there are also some very fragmentary records of witchcraft cases in "Historical Records", which basically do not talk about the incident itself, but mainly focus on the ending of the people involved. There are always different opinions on whether these contents were written by Sima Qian or added by later generations.

;

;In the Song Dynasty more than a thousand years later, when Sima Guang wrote "Zi Zhi Tong Jian", based on Ban Gu's outline, he finally provided us with a complete and logical account of the witchcraft incident. A narrative that is rigorous, coherent, with strong conflicts and rich in details.

;

;This story tells the story of the conflict between a talented but cruel father and a less talented but kind-hearted prince. Emperor Wu of the Han Dynasty hoped to finish all the most difficult things during his lifetime, leaving a country in need of rest and recuperation for his son to govern. This just happens to be the perfect combination.

;

;However, those who specifically helped Emperor Wu of the Han Dynasty carry out brutal tasks knew that they would be doomed once the prince ascended the throne. So they tried every possible means to sabotage this plan. The most vicious one among them was Jiang Chong.

;

;Emperor Wu of the Han Dynasty hoped to reach an understanding with his son again and again, but treacherous ministers and villains pushed the prince to a dead end while sending the wrong message to Emperor Wu of the Han Dynasty. Finally a catastrophe occurred.

;

;After knowing the truth, Emperor Wu of the Han Dynasty punished the treacherous minister and expressed his longing for the prince in his womb.

;

;This is a very sad, touching and educational story. Imagine that with Ban Gu's character, if you could read this story a thousand years later, you would probably express your appreciation instead of criticizing him.

;

;In recent years, many books and TV programs introducing Emperor Wu of the Han Dynasty are based on the story of Sima Guang. Some people even extend it further, such as adding Sima Qian into this story.

;

;Then, this version of a traitor driving a wedge between father and son is cute, but I’m afraid it’s not believable. In the following, we use historical data as a basis, combined with our understanding of the operation of power and human nature, to peel off the cocoons and present the truth of the witchcraft disaster as much as possible.

;

;Liu Kun: Between Liu Zheng and Liu Fuling

;

;Let’s start with the son of Emperor Wu of the Han Dynasty. In order to introduce the six sons of Emperor Wu of the Han Dynasty, Ban Gu wrote "Biography of the Five Sons of Wu" and Sima Qian wrote "The Family of Three Kings".

;

;"The Biography of the Five Sons of Wu" writes about the five sons of Emperor Wu of the Han Dynasty, which is natural. Because there is another son, Emperor Zhao of Han, who inherited the throne, naturally he should not be placed with others.

;

;"The Family of Three Kings" only writes about three sons, which is a bit strange; and the content of this article is also very abnormal. It only copies the relevant documents when the three princes were canonized as princes and kings.

;

;Of course there is a lot of debate as to why this is the case. But the title "Family of Three Kings" was decided by Sima Qian himself, there is no doubt about it.

;

;The three people mentioned in this article are: the second son of Emperor Wu of the Han Dynasty, King Qi Liu Hong, the third son King Yan Liu Dan, and the fourth son King Guangling Liu Xu.

;

;The three people not mentioned are: the eldest son Liu Zhi, the crown prince of Wei, the fifth son Liu Kun, the king of Changyi, and the youngest son Liu Fuling, who later became Emperor Zhao of Han Dynasty.

;

;A simple explanation is that the first three were crowned kings on the same day in the sixth year of Yuanshou (117 BC), and no other people were involved.

;

;But you can also make more complicated guesses: Ban Gu was from the Eastern Han Dynasty, so he naturally knew who succeeded him as emperor; Sima Qian was a person involved in the era of Emperor Wu of the Han Dynasty. When he wrote "The Family of Three Kings", he did not write All three of them have the possibility of inheriting the throne, and it is not appropriate to include them in the family. Even if the three people are included, it is inconvenient to say a lot of things. The only way to be safe is to copy official documents.

;

;In the eyes of many people, only Liu Zhi and Liu Fuling are important.

;

;There is also Li Guang's grandson, "Yu dared to be favored by the prince, but he was fond of profit, and Li's mausoleum has declined slowly." Li Yu, who was favored by the prince, was a vulgar money addict in the eyes of Sima Qian , and is the unworthy descendant of his beloved flying general Li Guang.

;

;The conflict between the prince and Emperor Wu of Han Dynasty broke out. To put it bluntly, it was just a struggle between two political forces. There was no "battle between two lines", and there was no morality or ideal at all. But they have been forced to this point, and no one can retreat. What they are fighting for is not only the supreme imperial power, but also the humblest survival.

;

;In this way, if Sima Qian did not write about the disaster of witchcraft, he might as well give a literary explanation: his heroic and heroic pen could not face this era.

;

;The era of Emperor Wu of the Han Dynasty before Taichu in his works was, of course, full of violence and bloodstains, but there were also numerous heroes and heroes. Even the despicable and shameless characters he hated were still high-spirited and majestic. , this kind of afterglow shone into the Tianhan years, but by Taishi and Zhenghe, there was really only suffocating madness and calculation left.

;

;The world has changed not because someone died, but because tonight's cold wind blew down the stars of last night, and the stars in the sky naturally and irrevocably dimmed.

;

;From this point of view, I would rather the story told by Sima Guang is true, and it seems to have a bit of idealism and family affection.

;Alzheimer's disease is often seen as a disease of the elderly, so young people suffer from Alzheimer's disease The disease will produce more interpretations. At the same time, new research has found that the simplest way to prevent the early onset or younger onset of Alzheimer's disease is to have a good night's sleep.

;

;On January 31, 2023, Jia Jianping’s team at Xuanwu Hospital reported in the Journal of Alzheimer’s Disease that a patient developed memory impairment at the age of 17 and was diagnosed with Alzheimer’s disease at the age of 19. (AD) patients. This is the youngest patient to date. The patient suffered from memory loss, frequently lost personal belongings, could not remember whether he had eaten or not, and was ultimately unable to complete his studies and had to drop out of high school. Previously, patients younger than 30 years old have been reported, with the youngest age of onset being 21 years old.

;

;In the process of diagnosis and treatment of the patient, the research team found that the patient's main symptom was memory decline, especially episodic memory decline. Combined with the Wechsler Memory Scale and Auditory Word Learning Test assessment, the patient's main symptoms were memory decline, especially episodic memory decline. A diagnosis was made. However, the patient had no family history of hereditary disease and could not find other causes of memory impairment such as genetics, infections, and systemic diseases. After whole-genome sequencing, it was found that the patient did not carry any risk or pathogenic gene mutations, ruling out the possibility of familial Alzheimer's disease. Therefore, its pathogenesis requires further study.

;

;In fact, Alzheimer’s disease is not exclusive to the elderly, but young people can also get it. Currently, there are at least 50 million dementia patients worldwide, and it is expected that the number will reach 152 million by 2050, of which about 60%-70% are Alzheimer's disease patients.

;

;Research on Alzheimer's disease has long been classified. The disease has a youthful form, but this is not an independent disease. Alzheimer's disease is classified according to the age at onset. A standard and a title. Alzheimer's disease is divided into early-onset Alzheimer's disease (also known as young-onset Alzheimer's disease) and late-onset Alzheimer's disease. Early-onset Alzheimer's disease refers to Alzheimer's disease that occurs in adults between the ages of 18 and 64, and those younger than 35 are called very early-onset Alzheimer's disease.

;

;Age statistics of Alzheimer's disease patients in various countries around the world show that the average age of onset of the disease is 51 years old. Young-onset Alzheimer's disease accounts for 4%-6% of Alzheimer's disease. However, most cases of young-onset Alzheimer's disease develop between the ages of 45 and 65. Statistics in the United States show that the mortality rate of young-onset Alzheimer's disease among those aged 40-64 is 24.2%. Now, the 19-year-old patient diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease in China belongs to the ultra-early form.

;

;The "Insight Report on the Needs of Alzheimer's Disease Patients" released by the National Health Commission on September 20, 2023 pointed out that there are currently about 15.07 million dementia patients in China aged 60 and above, among which Alzheimer's patients There are 9.83 million patients with Alzheimer's disease, and it is expected that by 2050, the number of Alzheimer's patients will exceed 40 million.

;

;As the prevalence of Alzheimer's disease continues to rise in China, this disease, which mainly affects people over 60 years old, has shown a new characteristic in China. The incidence of Alzheimer's disease is increasing among young people in China. . Reported statistics show that the incidence of Alzheimer's disease is 2.5% for those under 40 years old; 4.1% for 40-49 year olds; 14.7% for 50-59 year olds; 28.9% for 60-69 year olds; and 70-79 year olds. 33.2%; 16.6% for those aged 80 and above.

;

;It can be seen that the high-risk group of the disease is 60-79 years old, accounting for 62.1%. Alzheimer's disease is said to have early onset when it occurs under the age of 60. In China, 21.3% of patients with Alzheimer's disease are under the age of 60. Compared with the international incidence rate of 5%-10% in this age group, China's early-onset incidence rate has increased significantly.

;

;Whether it is China or the United Nations standards, people under 50 years old are middle-aged and young people. China's "Law of the People's Republic of China on the Protection of the Rights and Interests of the Elderly" collectively refers to citizens over 60 years old as the elderly. However, according to the classification of life by the United Nations and World Health Organization in 2020, there are 5 stages. Minors: 0 to 17 years old; young people: 18 to 65 years old; middle-aged people: 66 to 79 years old; elderly: 80 to 99 years old; longevity elderly: over 100 years old.

;

;If according to the new standards of the United Nations, 18-65 years old are all young people, then half of the patients with Alzheimer's disease in China may be young people.

;

;There are many factors that contribute to the development of Alzheimer's disease, but taking one simple preventative approach can reduce the incidence and number of people affected by the disease. Some previous studies have found a link between napping and Alzheimer's disease. A long-term follow-up survey of the leisure activities and sleep conditions of more than 20,000 elderly people found that those who have the habit of napping have about a 37% lower risk of developing Alzheimer's disease than those who do not take naps.

;

;However, this was only a study of older adults. A recent study on young and middle-aged people found that as long as they have good deep sleep, they can effectively prevent Alzheimer's disease, especially the younger generation of the disease.

;

;Researchers from the Framingham Heart Institute, the University of Texas and other centers in the United States have just published the results of a study in the Journal of the American Medical Association ( JAMA) showing that deep sleep helps To slow down brain aging, every 1% decrease in deep sleep per year is associated with a 27% increase in the risk of dementia, suggesting that maintaining deep sleep time can prevent Alzheimer's disease.

;

;For this study, researchers used data from the Framingham Heart Study, a long-term, ongoing cardiovascular cohort study of residents of Framingham, Massachusetts. The study began in 1948 with 5,209 adults in Framingham and has continued for more than seventy years.

;

;In the study, researchers analyzed 346 participants from the Framingham Heart Study cohort who were in their thirties when they originally entered the study (1995-1998). A standard young man. Study participants completed two nocturnal sleep studies measuring polysomnography (PSG) between 1995-1998 and 2001-2003, with an average interval of 5 years between studies. The researchers recorded the participants' Alzheimer's disease status over the next 17 years and analyzed the relationship between deep sleep and Alzheimer's disease risk.

;

;Study participants' average percentage of deep sleep at baseline was 18.1%, and participants' deep sleep time decreased between the two nightly sleep studies, suggesting that deep sleep increases with age. reduce. During the 17 years of follow-up, 52 patients with Alzheimer's disease were diagnosed.

;

;After adjusting for other influencing factors, the researchers found that each 1% decrease in deep sleep per year was associated with a 27% increase in the risk of all-cause Alzheimer's disease and a 32% increase in the risk of Alzheimer's disease. % related. The study also found that in the presence of a genetic risk for Alzheimer's disease (APOE4 allele), the decrease in deep sleep accelerates with age, but changes in brain volume do not affect deep sleep time. This means that Alzheimer's disease can be effectively prevented if people maintain a normal amount of deep sleep.

;

;The reason is that deep sleep is essential for the brain to remove metabolic waste, including the main proteins that accumulate in Alzheimer's disease, such as amyloid beta (Aβ) and tau protein. At the same time, as we age, there will be less and less deep sleep, which may lead to a continued weakening of lymphoid fluid clearance, increase the risk of Aβ and Tau protein formation, and lead to neurodegenerative diseases or Alzheimer's disease . At the same time, insufficient deep sleep is also associated with the development of vascular risk factors and may lead to dementia through the accumulation of cerebrovascular disease.

;

;Although this study does not reveal the exact cause-and-effect relationship between insufficient deep sleep and Alzheimer's disease, maintaining deep sleep time is a simple way to prevent Alzheimer's disease, and it can be done at a young age. You should have and maintain good deep sleep when you are young, because the time of deep sleep is different for different ages.  

;

;Deep sleep is also called golden sleep. It is the stage when people sleep the deepest and most soundly. At this time, they cannot hear any noise outside and it is difficult to be awakened by others. During deep sleep, the human body has a powerful body repair function, and the effect of relieving fatigue is also most obvious. For young people aged 20-30, deep sleep accounts for 20%-25% of their sleep time every night, while for elderly people aged 70-80, deep sleep accounts for only 5%-7% of their total sleep time every night.

;

;Deep sleep is related to the duration of sleep, which is another manifestation of quantity and quality. When an average person sleeps less than 6 hours a night, deep sleep will be reduced. Moreover, if you want to have better and more time of deep sleep, you must first fall asleep before 23:00. 23:00 to 3:00 the next morning is the best time to enter deep sleep. Once you miss it, no matter how long you sleep afterwards, you will It's hard to make up for it.

;

;In addition, even a very short nap, 1-3 pm is the optimal rest time, which can enhance the brain's memory processing ability.

;

;In the information age, in order to reduce and prevent the early onset of Alzheimer's disease, it is best not to stay up late and maintain normal and better deep sleep.
